text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kyokawa was born in Omitama on December 28, 1993. After graduating from Tokiwagi Gakuen High School, she joined INAC Kobe Leonessa in 2012. In 2010, Kyokawa was selected the Japan U-17 national team for 2010 U-17 World Cup. She played 6 games and scored 3 goals. Japan won the 2nd place. In February 2012, when she was 18 years old, she was selected the Japan national team for 2012 Algarve Cup. At this competition, on February 29, she debuted against Norway. She played 5 games for Japan until 2015. ==Statistics== List of match in 2012, 2015 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2012 2 0 2013 0 0 2014 0 0 2015 3 0 Total 5 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Ibaraki Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:INAC Kobe Leonessa players
title: Mai Kyokawa
